titleStmt.title: Letter of Invitation to the Woman's Club Baby Conference in Jacksonville. 1916.
titleStmt.author: Colored Woman's Club

publicationStmt.p: This document forms part of the project "Editing the Earth M.M. White Collection" at the University of North Florida.

msIdentifier.repository: University of North Florida, Thomas G. Carpenter Library Special Collections and Archives

msContents.summary: The author writes a letter of invitation to the Woman's Club Baby Conference held in March 6th to 11th, 1916.

editorialDecl.p: This file was transcribed and encoded according to the editorial criteria of the project "Editing the Eartha M.M. White Collection." Using the various options encoded within <choice> elements, this file enables the viewing of a diplomatic transcription and a regularized reading text.

body.p:
You are cordially invited to bring your babies,
under five years,
to the Woman's Club
18 East Duval Street,
To the
Baby Conference
to be held
March 6 to 11th, 1946,
between 9: A. M. and 5: P. M. daily.
This Conference will be conducted by
Dr. Frances Sage Bradley,
an expert on infant health and is intended to show
the physical condition of babies
brought for examination
and to indicate ppints at which their health and vigor
may be improved by the effort of
their parents.
All babies brought must be free from
communicable disease, rash, colds,
sore throat, inflamed eyes, etc. A record of
examination will be given to each mother
Friday
SatSaturday
March 10 and morning of March 14
reserved for colored babies.
